channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Blindspots and turncoats: How Trump's mostly white casting has backfired
item.description: Even the nation's most powerful casting director sometimes gets it wrong.

item.title: Facebook takes down Trump ads for using symbol that looks like one used by Nazis
item.description: Facebook on Thursday said it had take action against ads run by President Trump's re-election campaign for breaching its policies on hate. The ads, which attacked what the Trump campaign described as "Dangerous MOBS of far-left groups," featured an upside-down triangle.

item.title: The Trump presidency is at its absolute lowest point right now
item.description: Everywhere Donald Trump looks right now, he sees political fires that threaten to engulf his presidency.

item.title: Trump reacts to bombshells from John Bolton's new book
item.description: During an interview on Fox News, President Donald Trump reacted to the stunning accusations in former national security adviser John Bolton's new book, calling Bolton a "washed-up guy."

item.title: India may be about to ramp up an alliance Beijing can't stand
China's military edge over India may no longer exist
John Roberts defies Trump and conservatives with another legacy decision
The country where it feels like Covid-19 never happened
item.description: The bars and restaurants are full. People are out enjoying themselves. Spectacular geological attractions are wide open to tourists. Anyone visiting Iceland right now could be forgiven for thinking they've arrived in a parallel universe where the coronovirus never happened.

item.title: Trump acknowledges people may catch Covid-19 at his rally
Night burials and unexplained deaths: This country's outbreak may be far worse than the official story
item.description: Nicaragua has seen its fair share of unrest, fear and struggles throughout its troubled history. Now, faced with the deadly coronavirus, the government is coming under fire for its casual approach to containing the pandemic.

item.title: Florida has the makings of the next Covid-19 epicenter, experts say
Why a gun shop owner banned masks for walk-in customers
item.description: Florida gun shop owner Alex Shkop, talks to CNN's Brianna Keilar about why he's choosing to ban masks for walk-in customers from his store amid a pandemic.

item.title: The 37 most shocking lines from Trump's 'interview' with Sean Hannity
item.description: Faced with faltering poll numbers and a huge furor caused by allegations made in John Bolton's soon-to-be-released memoir of his time in the White House, President Donald Trump retreated to the warm embrace of Fox News on Wednesday night.

item.title: Canadian politician kicked out of parliament after calling opponent 'racist'
item.description: The leader of Canada's New Democratic Party, Jagmeet Singh, was made to leave parliament on Wednesday after calling another politician "racist."

item.title: Ex-Atlanta officers involved in Rayshard Brooks killing turn themselves in
Half-brother of man found hanged dies in a deputy-involved shooting
item.description: The half-brother of Robert Fuller, the 24-year-old black man who was found dead hanging in the city of Palmdale, California, last week, was killed in a deputy-involved shooting in Kern County on Wednesday, according to Fuller's family attorney.

item.title: White man rescued by Black Lives Matter protester is former police officer
item.description: A white man who was carried to safety by a Black Lives Matter protester after he was allegedly attacked amid violent clashes is a former police officer, British Transport Police confirmed.

item.title: This country has a message for African Americans: Come home
item.description: Ghana has a message for African Americans in the wake of George Floyd's death: "Africa is your home." Officials in Ghana's capital Accra are inviting Americans to live and invest in the West African nation. CNN's Stephanie Busari reports.

item.title: Too much sitting raises risk for cancer, study finds
item.description: Too much sitting can raise the risk for cancer, but you can overcome it with movement, a new study finds. Replacing at least 30 minutes of sitting with either light, moderate or vigorous physical activity can lower that risk.

item.title: Scientists have grown mini brains containing Neanderthal DNA
item.description: A team of researchers has grown blobs of brain tissue from human stem cells that contain Neanderthal DNA. The hope is that this research will shed more light on how Neanderthals relate to modern humans.

item.title: JFK's last surviving sibling, Jean Kennedy Smith, dies at 92
item.description: Jean Kennedy Smith, a former diplomat and the last surviving sibling of President John F. Kennedy, died Wednesday in her New York apartment, her daughter, Kym Smith, told CNN. She was 92.

item.title: $190 oil sounds crazy. But JPMorgan thinks it's possible, even after the pandemic
item.description: In a little-noticed report, JPMorgan Chase warned in early March that the oil market could be on the cusp of a "supercycle" that sends Brent crude skyrocketing as high as $190 a barrel in 2025.

item.title: Joe Biden will accept Democratic presidential nomination in Milwaukee
item.description: Joe Biden will formally accept the Democratic presidential nomination in Milwaukee in August, two officials familiar with planning say, as the scaled-back party convention with a major digital component enters the final stages of planning two months before it is scheduled to begin.

item.title: Siberia is having 'alarming' prolonged warm weather
item.description: Siberia's prolonged period of unusually warm weather is an "alarming sign," according to climate change scientists.

item.title: Hear UK foreign secretary's 'Game of Thrones' comment on 'taking the knee'
item.description: Britain's Foreign Secretary, Dominic Raab said he has "full respect" for the Black Lives Matter movement, after saying that the gesture of "taking the knee" felt more like a symbol of subjugation than liberation.

item.title: Care home creates 'hug tunnel' so loved ones can embrace elderly relatives
item.description: A care home for elderly people in southern Brazil has come up with a creative way to bring some love to its residents amid the coronavirus pandemic, by creating a "hug tunnel" that allows relatives to safely embrace them.

item.title: Renowned Amazon chief dies in state ravaged by coronavirus
item.description: Paulinho Paiakan, a Kayap chief known for his environmental protests in Brazil, died Wednesday, according to advocacy group Articulation of the Indigenous Peoples of Brazil (APIB).

item.title: Transatlantic trade fight looms as US blows up talks on taxing big tech
Qantas cancels international flights until October. New Zealand may be the exception
item.description: Australian flagship carrier Qantas has canceled most of its international flights for the next four months on the expectation that the coronavirus pandemic will last through most of the year.

item.title: This drug reduces risk of death in severe Covid-19 patients, trial suggests
item.description: A preliminary study in the UK has shown how the widely available steroid drug dexamethasone may be key in helping to treat the sickest Covid-19 patients who require ventilation or oxygen.

item.title: German prosecutor accuses Russia of ordering murder in Berlin park
item.description: Germany's top prosecutor has accused Russia of ordering the murder of a Georgian man in a Berlin park, as they announced that a suspected contract killer has been charged over the killing.

item.title: 'Living in fear': Hungary ban throws transgender people into limbo
Is it safer to drive or fly during the pandemic?
item.description: As the summer travel season gets underway, HLN's Lynn Smith has tips on how to stay safe while driving or flying during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: British singer Vera Lynn dies aged 103
item.description: British singer Vera Lynn, whose sentimental ballads during World War II provided the soundtrack for the Allied war effort, has died at the age of 103, according to a statement from the Dame Vera Lynn Children's Charity on Thursday.

item.title: Reality star admits to $2,500-a-day meth habit
item.description: Things got really bad for Mama June Shannon, the reality star admitted.

item.title: Ford's electric Mustang will offer hands-free driving technology next year
item.description: Owners of Ford's Mustang Mach-E electric SUV will be able to add hands-free highway driving technology to their vehicles late next year.

item.title: Evidence of huge carnivorous dinosaurs discovered in Australia
item.description: Scientists have found evidence that large carnivorous dinosaurs lived in Australia.

item.title: Kristen Stewart set to play Princess Diana
item.description: Kristen Stewart is set to play Princess Diana in an upcoming movie that will focus on the late princess' split from Prince Charles.

item.title: Top black player welcomes 'massive step' after players take a knee before Premier League restart
item.description: Manchester City forward Raheem Sterling says players taking a knee before the Premier League restart was a "massive step" in the fight against racism.

item.title: Player slams 'disgusting discrimination' as US Open omits wheelchair tennis
item.description: Australian Dylan Alcott has slammed US Open organizers for their "disgusting discrimination" in choosing to omit wheelchair tennis from this year's tournament.

item.title: Ford is bringing back its iconic Mustang Mach 1
item.description: First introduced in 1969, the Mach 1 supercar is getting a revamp. With a V8 engine and an expected 480 horsepower, the car is made for track driving.

item.title: The boy from town 'where dreams seem unreachable' who became a global superstar
item.description: Laguna Larga is an unassuming Argentine town of no more than 6,000 inhabitants.

item.title: 3-year-old boy forms bond with train conductor
item.description: 3-year-old Jake who loves trains formed a special bond with a train conductor in Massachusetts after Jake spent time during quarantine watching trains go by.

item.title: This Bahamas sculpture garden is underwater
item.description: There are 700 islands in the Bahamas, 2,000 beaches, 32 national parks -- and one underwater art installation.

item.title: Florida has makings of next epicenter, experts say
item.description: Ten states saw a record number of new Covid-19 cases this week, and one of them could be the next epicenter of the pandemic.

item.title: India may be about to ramp up an alliance Beijing can't stand
China's military edge over India may no longer exist
item.description: Analysis: Border dispute may push India closer to some of China's top rivals Satellite images show where clash took place

item.title: Ex-officers involved in Rayshard Brooks killing turn themselves
item.description: LIVE UPDATES: 'What I witnessed was real horrific,' says Brooks shooting witness

item.title: China responds to explosive allegations
item.description: A Chinese spokesman responded to explosive claims made in former national security adviser John Bolton's book that President Donald Trump asked China for help to get him reelected. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: Fauci warns of 'anti-science bias' in US
item.description: The White House coronavirus task force has been out of public view as President Donald Trump has shown an urgency to move past the pandemic, downplay recent surges in Covid cases in some states, and get Americans back to work.
